messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Peculiar Pier Perplexity DATE: 09/09/69 The courtroom was a medley of skepticism and scrutiny as the trial ensued. The prosecution called forth the officers key to the investigation to elucidate on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Adams, the lead investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Adams. Can you recap the events on the evening the perplexity was uncovered? WITNESS: Certainly. On the evening of February 2nd, Officer C. D. Clark spotted suspicious activity near the pier and reported it. The investigation was launched forthwith. PROSECUTOR: Who led the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Edwards and Technician G. H. Harrison spearheaded the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who conducted the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Johnson and K. L. Lewis handled the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense commenced a rigorous cross-examination of Lieutenant Adams concerning the investigative techniques employed. During the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Peters, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn were also summoned to the stand.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Adams 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Adams is the lead investigator in the Peculiar Pier Perplexity case, narrating the events on the evening the perplexity was uncovered during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Clark 
Officer Context: Officer Clark noticed suspicious activity near the pier on the evening of February 2nd, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Edwards 
Officer Context: Sergeant Edwards, alongside Technician G. H. Harrison, led the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harrison 
Officer Context: Technician Harrison worked with Sergeant E. F. Edwards on the forensic analysis concerning the suspicious activity at the pier. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Johnson 
Officer Context: Detective Johnson, alongside Detective K. L. Lewis, conducted interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the perplexity. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Lewis 
Officer Context: Detective Lewis, along with Detective I. J. Johnson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Peters 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Peters was also called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Quinn was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
